name: CG-SURG-83 Bariatric Surgery and Other Treatments for Clinically Severe Obesity
description: This document addresses surgical and other treatments for clinically severe obesity. Clinically severe obesity is a result of persistent and uncontrollable weight gain that constitutes a present or potential threat to life. There are a variety of surgical procedures and other treatment modalities intended for the treatment of clinically severe obesity.

restrictions.condition: Individual is age 18 years or older for medically necessary gastric bypass and gastric restrictive procedures.
Recommended bariatric procedure is Biliopancreatic bypass with duodenal switch.
Recommended bariatric procedure is Laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding.
Recommended bariatric procedure is Roux-en-Y procedure up to 150 cm.
Recommended bariatric procedure is Sleeve gastrectomy.
Recommended bariatric procedure is Vertical banded gastroplasty.
Body Mass Index (BMI) of 40 or greater.
Body Mass Index (BMI) of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically Diabetes mellitus.
Body Mass Index (BMI) of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically Cardiovascular disease.
Body Mass Index (BMI) of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically Hypertension.
Body Mass Index (BMI) of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically life threatening cardio-pulmonary problems such as severe obstructive sleep apnea.
Body Mass Index (BMI) of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically life threatening cardio-pulmonary problems such as Pickwickian syndrome.
Body Mass Index (BMI) of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically life threatening cardio-pulmonary problems such as obesity related cardiomyopathy.
Documentation of past participation in a weight loss program.
Documentation of inadequate weight loss despite a committed attempt at conservative medical therapy.
Documentation of pre-operative medical and mental health evaluations and clearances.
Documentation of pre-operative education addressing risks, benefits, realistic expectations and the need for long-term follow-up and adherence to behavioral modifications.
Documentation of a treatment plan addressing the pre- and post-operative needs of an individual undergoing bariatric surgery.
Surgical repair/correction or reversal following gastric bypass and gastric restrictive procedures for a surgical complication related to the original surgery, specifically a fistula.
Surgical repair/correction or reversal following gastric bypass and gastric restrictive procedures for a surgical complication related to the original surgery, specifically an obstruction.
Surgical repair/correction or reversal following gastric bypass and gastric restrictive procedures for a surgical complication related to the original surgery, specifically an erosion.

Surgical repair/correction or reversal following gastric bypass and gastric restrictive procedures for a surgical complication related to the original surgery, specifically disruption/leakage of a suture/staple line.
Surgical repair/correction or reversal following gastric bypass and gastric restrictive procedures for a surgical complication related to the original surgery, specifically band herniation.
Surgical repair/correction or reversal following gastric bypass and gastric restrictive procedures for a surgical complication related to the original surgery, specifically a stricture.
Surgical repair/correction or reversal following gastric bypass and gastric restrictive procedures for documented gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).

Surgical repair/correction or reversal following gastric bypass and gastric restrictive procedures for a surgical complication related to the original surgery, specifically pouch enlargement/dilation.
For surgical revision/conversion due to inadequate weight loss or weight gain 1 year or longer after a prior procedure, the individual must meet all subsequent criteria.
For surgical revision/conversion due to inadequate weight loss or weight gain, BMI of 40 or greater.
For surgical revision/conversion due to inadequate weight loss or weight gain, BMI of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically Diabetes mellitus.
For surgical revision/conversion due to inadequate weight loss or weight gain, BMI of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically Cardiovascular disease.
For surgical revision/conversion due to inadequate weight loss or weight gain, BMI of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically Hypertension.

For surgical revision/conversion due to inadequate weight loss or weight gain, BMI of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically life threatening cardio-pulmonary problems such as severe obstructive sleep apnea.

For surgical revision/conversion due to inadequate weight loss or weight gain, BMI of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically life threatening cardio-pulmonary problems such as Pickwickian syndrome.

For surgical revision/conversion due to inadequate weight loss or weight gain, BMI of 35 or greater with an obesity-related co-morbid condition, specifically life threatening cardio-pulmonary problems such as obesity related cardiomyopathy.
For surgical revision/conversion, documentation of pre-operative medical and mental health evaluations and clearances.

For surgical revision/conversion, documentation of pre-operative education which addresses the risks, benefits, realistic expectations and the need for long-term follow-up and adherence to behavioral modifications.
For surgical revision/conversion, documentation of a treatment plan which addresses the pre- and post-operative needs of an individual undergoing bariatric surgery.
Surgical revision/conversion is medically necessary when there is documentation of a complication related to the initial procedure, specifically obstruction.
Surgical revision/conversion is medically necessary when there is documentation of a complication related to the initial procedure, specifically stricture.
Surgical revision/conversion is medically necessary when there is documentation of a complication related to the initial procedure, specifically documented GERD.
Initial and reoperative bariatric procedures are considered not medically necessary when the medically necessary criteria are not met.
restrictions.rule: (NOT (patient_age >= 18)) OR (NOT (procedure_type_biliopancreatic_bypass_duodenal_switch = TRUE OR procedure_type_laparoscopic_adjustable_gastric_banding = TRUE OR procedure_type_roux_en_y_gastric_bypass = TRUE OR procedure_type_sleeve_gastrectomy = TRUE OR procedure_type_vertical_banded_gastroplasty = TRUE)) OR (NOT (patient_bmi_threshold_40 >= 40.0 OR (patient_bmi_threshold_35 >= 35.0 AND (diagnosis_diabetes_mellitus = TRUE OR diagnosis_cardiovascular_disease = TRUE OR diagnosis_hypertension = TRUE OR diagnosis_obstructive_sleep_apnea = TRUE OR diagnosis_pickwickian_syndrome = TRUE OR diagnosis_obesity_related_cardiomyopathy = TRUE)))) OR (NOT (past_weight_loss_program_participation = TRUE AND inadequate_weight_loss_conservative_therapy = TRUE AND preoperative_medical_mental_health_clearance = TRUE AND preoperative_education_complete = TRUE AND bariatric_surgery_treatment_plan = TRUE))

restrictions.condition: Endoluminal reoperative bariatric procedures, including transoral outlet reduction (TORe) or restorative obesity surgery endoluminal (ROSE), are considered not medically necessary for all indications.
restrictions.rule: NOT (procedure_type_other IN ('transoral outlet reduction', 'restorative obesity surgery endoluminal'))

restrictions.condition: Laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding is considered not medically necessary for individuals with a BMI below 35 kg/m².
One anastomosis gastric bypass (mini gastric bypass) is not medically necessary.
Malabsorptive procedure: Jejunoileal bypass is not medically necessary.
Malabsorptive procedure: Biliopancreatic bypass without duodenal switch is not medically necessary.
Malabsorptive procedure: Single anastomosis duodenal switch is not medically necessary.
Malabsorptive procedure: Very long limb (greater than 150 cm) gastric bypass (other than biliopancreatic bypass with duodenal switch) is not medically necessary.
Minimally invasive endoluminal gastric restrictive surgical technique: EndoGastric StomaphyX™ endoluminal fastener and delivery system is not medically necessary.
Minimally invasive endoluminal gastric restrictive surgical technique: Endoscopic sleeve gastroplasty is not medically necessary.
Laparoscopic gastric plication (LGCP) with or without gastric banding is not medically necessary.
Balloon system: Orbera Intragastric Balloon System is not medically necessary.
Balloon system: TransPyloric Shuttle is not medically necessary.
Vagus (or vagal) nerve blocking devices are not medically necessary.
Endoscopically placed percutaneous aspiration tube (AspireAssist®) is not medically necessary.
Bariatric surgery for individuals under 18 years old with severe morbid obesity and unique circumstances may be considered with Medical Director approval.
Adolescent age range (10 to 19 years) for bariatric surgery consideration.
Pediatric BMI threshold of 35 kg/m2 or 120% of the 95th percentile with a clinically significant co-morbid condition(s) for surgical consideration.
Pediatric BMI threshold of 40 kg/m2 or 140% of the 95th percentile (whichever is lower) for surgical consideration.
Laparoscopic Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass (RYGB) is considered a common and effective procedure in pediatric population.
Vertical Sleeve Gastrectomy is considered a common and effective procedure in pediatric population.
Patient's Tanner pubertal development stage is 4 or 5 for pediatric bariatric surgery eligibility.
Patient has achieved final or near final adult height for pediatric bariatric surgery eligibility.
Metabolic surgery may be considered for adolescents with type 2 diabetes and Class 2 obesity or higher (BMI > 35 kg/m2 or 120% of 95th percentile for age and sex, whichever is lower).
Adolescent patient has elevated A1C despite lifestyle and pharmacologic intervention.
Adolescent patient has serious comorbidities despite lifestyle and pharmacologic intervention.
Eligible individuals under the age of 18 years must be skeletally mature for surgery consideration.
Eligible individuals under the age of 18 years must have a suitable psychiatric profile and developmental stage for pre- and post-operative care compliance and long-term follow-up.
Informed consent must be conducted including documentation that the individual has received and can fully understand a thorough explanation of the risks, benefits, and uncertainties of the procedure.
Medically necessary CPT codes for gastric bypass and gastric restrictive procedures/reoperations.
Medically necessary ICD-10-PCS codes for gastric restrictive procedures and reoperations.
Medically necessary ICD-10-PCS codes for other bypass and excision procedures.
Medically necessary ICD-10 Diagnosis codes for obesity and BMI.
ICD-10 Diagnosis codes indicating BMI ranges considered not medically necessary (BMI 20.0-29.9, adult).
ICD-10 Diagnosis codes indicating BMI ranges considered not medically necessary (BMI 30.0-34.9, adult).
CPT codes for procedures identified as not medically necessary.
HCPCS codes for procedures identified as not medically necessary.
ICD-10-PCS codes for procedures identified as not medically necessary.
